dt: {bc}to perform a function {bc}exert power or influence
{bc}to perform an {a_link|operation} or a series of {a_link|operations}

dt.t: The refinery is planning to begin {it}operating{/it} as soon as possible.
The surgeon has been {it}operating{/it} all morning.

dt: {bc}to carry on a military or naval action or mission

dt.t: The army will {wi}operate{/wi} in conjunction with the air force.

dt: {bc}to follow a course of conduct that is often irregular

et: borrowed from Late Latin {it}operātus,{/it} past participle of {it}operārī{/it} "to work, be efficacious, effect, produce," going back to Latin, "to busy oneself, be at work," probably back-formation from {it}operātus{/it} "busy, engaged, occupied with religious observances," from {it}opera{/it} "activity, effort" + {it}-ātus{/it} {et_link|-ate:3|-ate:3} {ma}{mat|opera:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: to perform a function : exert power or influence
to perform an operation or a series of operations
